caption: Northern residents enjoy a sanctuary created just for them, where the whales enjoy rubbing their bodies on the smooth stones of the beach. (Image courtesy of Explore.Org)
Photos from underwater cameras show the richness of the waters at the rubbing beach at the Robson Bight (Michael Bigg) Ecological Reserve, including abundant fish. (Courtesy of Explore.org)
A school of silvery forage fish feeds a wide variety of sea life. (Courtesy of Explore.org)
Cleaner and more remote, these waters allow a wide variety of sea life to flourish. (Courtesy of Explore.org)
Northern resident orcas swoop in for a nice long scratch at the rubbing beach. (Courtesy of Explore.org)
Diving ducks swish through the waters. (Courtesy of Explore.org)
Silvery fish shine in the depths. (Courtesy of Explore.org)
A harbor seal takes a good long look at the camera. Is that a smile? (Courtesy of Explore.org)
Salmon stoke the food chain. (Courtesy of Explore.org)
Orcas raise a cloud of sand with the vigor of their back scratching at the rubbing beach. (Courtesy of Explore.org)
Schools of fish show the abundance of the waters in the ecological reserve. (Courtesy of Explore.org)
Hundreds of fish fill the camera's view. (Courtesy of Explore.org)
A giant orca glides low and slow during a nice long bout at the rubbing beach. (Courtesy of Explore.org)
